content_segments.text: For the hospital lab application, we're configuring a GDMI-600x600 filter housing with ZM (Zinc-Magnesium) material for C5 corrosion resistance.
This configuration requires careful consideration due to the presence of both Hygiene Requirements and an Explosive Atmosphere (ATEX Zone 22).

The Hygiene Requirements in a hospital environment suggest upgrading to C5 corrosion resistance per VDI 6022, which is satisfied by the ZM material selection. The housing itself has C4 corrosion class.
The Explosive Atmosphere requires all components to be grounded to prevent static discharge, which can act as an ignition source. To finalize the configuration, I need two details:

The GDMI housing itself has C4 corrosion resistance.Which housing length do you need?
